t: A song. A psalm of David.
My*pn heart, O God, is steadfast; I*ld will sing and make music with all my soul.
Awake,*ln harp and lyre! I*ld will awaken the dawn.
I*ln will praise you, Lord,*s among the nations; I*ld will sing of you among the peoples.
For*ln great is your love, higher than the heavens; your*ld faithfulness reaches to the skies.
Be*ln exalted, O God, above the heavens; let*ld your glory be over all the earth.
Save*pn us and help us with your right hand, that*ld those you love may be delivered.
God*ln has spoken from his sanctuary: “In*ld triumph I will parcel out Shechem and*ld measure off the Valley of Sukkoth.
Gilead*ln is mine, Manasseh is mine; Ephraim*ld is my helmet, Judah*ld is my scepter.
Moab*ln is my washbasin, on*ld Edom I toss my sandal; over*ld Philistia I shout in triumph.”
Who*pn will bring me to the fortified city? Who*ld will lead me to Edom?
Is*ln it not you, God, you who have rejected us and*ld no longer go out with our armies?
Give*ln us aid against the enemy, for*ld human help is worthless.
With*ln God we will gain the victory, and*ld he will trample down our enemies.
